stix:STIX_Header.stix:Title: A US Corporation Targeted With Phishing Email Containing Possible Dyre Trojan
stix:STIX_Header.stix:Description: On 20 August 2014, A US corporation received phishing emails with a malicious attachment containing possible Dyre (or Dyreza) credential harvesting banking Trojan. The email had the subject "ADP Invoice for week ending 08/15/2014 Invoice: 436441890" and used the sender address "Billing.Address.Updates@ADP.com". When executed, the malware called back to "http://kruppsmetal.com/demo/2008us2.exe" to download second stage malware "2008us2.exe". The second stage malware makes a series of connection attempts to multiple Session Traversal Utilities for NAT (STUN) servers, presumably to identify the publicly routable IP address of the end-point devices behind a NAT address.

stix:Indicator.indicator:Description:
-----Email Header-----Date: Wed, 20 Aug 2014 14:34:25 -0400From: "Billing.Address.Updates@ADP.com" X-Mailer: The Bat! (v3.51) HomeX-Priority: 3 (Normal)Message-ID: <8313808133.DN6FEDGJ411514@jmrwgjo.surhutequqite.biz>To: [REDACTED]Subject: ADP Invoice for week ending 08/15/2014 Invoice: 436441890 MIME-Version: 1.0Content-Type: multipart/mixed; boundary="----------75835EDFAC267AD"X-NAI-Spam-Flag: NOX-NAI-Spam-Threshold: 0X-NAI-Spam-Score: -5000X-NAI-Spam-Rules: 1 Rules triggered WHITELISTED=-5000X-NAI-Spam-Version: 2.3.0.9378 : core <5034> : inlines <1181> : streams <1263717> : uri <1802658>Return-Path: AmericanExpress@welcome.aexp.comX-MS-Exchange-Organization-AVStamp-Mailbox: SYMANTEC;521338944;0;infoX-MS-Exchange-Organization-AuthSource: [REDACTED]X-MS-Exchange-Organization-AuthAs: Anonymous-----End Email Header----------Email Body-----

Your most recent ADP invoice is attached for your review. If you have any questions regarding this invoice, please contact your ADP service team at the number or e-mail address provided on the invoice for assistance.

Thank you for choosing ADP for your business solutions.

Important: Please do not respond to this message. It is generated from an unattended mailbox.

-----End Email Body-----

EmailMessageObj:Header.EmailMessageObj:Subject: ADP Invoice for week ending 08/15/2014 Invoice: 436441890

stix:Indicator.indicator:Description: Calls back to download second stage malware.

This is second stage malware.The malware makes DNS requests for the below STUN servers.stun.2talk.co.nzgoogle.com 67.111.23.213s2.taraba.net 203.183.172.196stun.voxgratia.org 77.72.174.167stun.voipstunt.com 77.72.174.166stun3.l.google.com 74.125.136.127stun.faktortel.com.au 217.10.68.152stun.voiparound.com 77.72.169.166stun.voip.aebc.com 66.51.128.43stun1.l.google.com 173.194.73.127stun.stunprotocol.org 107.23.150.92stun.voipbuster.com 77.72.174.161stun.internetcalls.com 77.72.169.167stun.callwithus.com 198.27.81.168stun.phonepower.com 208.64.8.6stun.ipshka.com 193.28.184.4stun4.l.google.com 173.194.71.127stun.sipgate.net 217.10.68.152stun.noc.ams-ix.net 91.200.16.56
